catalog_info.title: Statistical Physics
catalog_info.notes: Students may wish to take Applied Physics 284 when this course is bracketed.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Physics 143a and Physics 181 or Engineering Sciences 181.
catalog_info.description: Basic principles of statistical physics and thermodynamics, with applications including: the equilibrium properties of classical and quantum gases, phase transitions and critical phenomena, as illustrated by the liquid-gas transition and simple magnetic models. Universality, scaling and renormalization group. Introduction to non-equilibrium physics.
